articles.headline: A President Unhappy, Unleashed and Unpredictable
articles.snippet: President Trump remains the most powerful man in the world, but powerless to achieve what he most wants: to avoid leaving office as a loser.
articles.abstract: President Trump remains the most powerful man in the world, but powerless to achieve what he most wants: to avoid leaving office as a loser.
articles.lead_paragraph: With four weeks left in President Trump’s term, he is at perhaps his most unleashed — and, as events of the past few days have demonstrated, at the most unpredictable point in his presidency.
articles.byline: By Maggie Haberman and Michael S. Schmidt

articles.headline: Reclaiming the Tiki Bar
articles.snippet: Tiki bars are a beverage industry mainstay — with a painful and underexamined past. Can the format be repaired?
articles.abstract: Tiki bars are a beverage industry mainstay — with a painful and underexamined past. Can the format be repaired?
articles.lead_paragraph: It is an unquestionably difficult time for the hospitality industry. Every day, another restaurant shutters, one more bar pulls its steel gate down for good. Since its invention, one kind of watering hole has seen America through its most grueling times: the tiki bar.
articles.byline: By Sammi Katz and Olivia McGiff

articles.headline: The Year the Fed Changed Forever
articles.snippet: Jerome H. Powell’s central bank slashed rates, bought bonds in huge sums and rolled out never-before-tried loan programs that shifted its identity. The backlash is already beginning.
articles.abstract: Jerome H. Powell’s central bank slashed rates, bought bonds in huge sums and rolled out never-before-tried loan programs that shifted its identity. The backlash is already beginning.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As Jerome H. Powell, the Federal Reserve chair, rang in 2020 in Florida, where he was celebrating his son’s wedding, his work life seemed to be entering a period of relative calm. President Trump’s public attacks on the central bank had eased up after 18 months of steady criticism, and the trade war with China seemed to be cooling, brightening the outlook for markets and the economy.

articles.headline: New Signs of Economic Distress Emerge as Trump Imperils Aid Deal
articles.snippet: A decline in consumer income and spending poses a further challenge to the recovery as jobless claims remain high and benefits approach a cutoff.
articles.abstract: A decline in consumer income and spending poses a further challenge to the recovery as jobless claims remain high and benefits approach a cutoff.
articles.lead_paragraph: With the fate of a federal aid package suddenly thrown into doubt by President Trump, economic data on Wednesday showed why the help is so desperately needed.

articles.headline: Blackwater’s Bullets Scarred Iraqis. Trump’s Pardon Renewed the Pain.
articles.snippet: Iraqi witnesses against Blackwater guards were promised justice after a mass killing in Baghdad in 2007. ‘Today,’ one said, the bullets still in his leg, ‘they proved to me it was just theater.’
articles.abstract: Iraqi witnesses against Blackwater guards were promised justice after a mass killing in Baghdad in 2007. ‘Today,’ one said, the bullets still in his leg, ‘they proved to me it was just theater.’
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD, Iraq — Haider Ahmed Rabia was stuck in traffic in Baghdad 13 years ago when guards with the American security contractor Blackwater opened fire with machine guns and grenade launchers, killing or wounding at least 31 Iraqi civilians. He still carries some of those bullets in his legs.
articles.byline: By Falih Hassan and Jane Arraf

articles.headline: Trump’s Attack on Coronavirus Relief Divides G.O.P. and Threatens Recovery
articles.snippet: From the campaign trail in Georgia to Capitol Hill, President Trump’s demand for changes to the $900 billion pandemic relief plan upended political and economic calculations.
articles.abstract: From the campaign trail in Georgia to Capitol Hill, President Trump’s demand for changes to the $900 billion pandemic relief plan upended political and economic calculations.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s denunciation of the $900 billion coronavirus relief deal drove a wedge through the Republican Party on Wednesday, drawing harsh criticism from House Republicans and threatening the delivery of unemployment checks, a reprieve on evictions and direct payments to struggling Americans.
articles.byline: By Luke Broadwater, Emily Cochrane, Astead W. Herndon and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Trump Gives Clemency to More Allies, Including Manafort, Stone and Charles Kushner
articles.snippet: It was the second wave of pardons and commutations by the president in two days, showing his willingness to use his power aggressively on behalf of loyalists.
articles.abstract: It was the second wave of pardons and commutations by the president in two days, showing his willingness to use his power aggressively on behalf of loyalists.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Trump doled out clemency to a new group of loyalists on Wednesday, wiping away convictions and sentences as he aggressively employed his power to override courts, juries and prosecutors to apply his own standard of justice for his allies.
articles.byline: By Maggie Haberman and Michael S. Schmidt

articles.headline: With Alibaba Investigation, China Gets Tougher on Tech
articles.snippet: Jack Ma and other entrepreneurs prospered under Beijing’s laissez-faire attitude toward the business side of the internet. The dynamic is shifting as the companies have grown in power.
articles.abstract: Jack Ma and other entrepreneurs prospered under Beijing’s laissez-faire attitude toward the business side of the internet. The dynamic is shifting as the companies have grown in power.
articles.lead_paragraph: China’s internet giants came to dominate segments of the world’s No. 2 economy because Beijing’s authoritarian government largely looked the other way while they grew and grew.

articles.headline: With Money, and Waste, China Fights for Chip Independence
articles.snippet: Beijing’s drive to free itself from reliance on imported semiconductors has lifted start-ups and big firms alike. Some have flamed out. But there has been progress.
articles.abstract: Beijing’s drive to free itself from reliance on imported semiconductors has lifted start-ups and big firms alike. Some have flamed out. But there has been progress.
articles.lead_paragraph: Liu Fengfeng had more than a decade under his belt at one of the world’s most prominent technology companies before he realized where the real gold rush in China was taking place.
articles.byline: By Raymond Zhong and Cao Li

articles.headline: Bollywood, Reeling From the Pandemic, Shifts to Streaming
articles.snippet: India’s film industry, which relied on theatrical releases, is experimenting with going straight to streaming services such as Amazon, Netflix and Disney’s Hotstar.
articles.abstract: India’s film industry, which relied on theatrical releases, is experimenting with going straight to streaming services such as Amazon, Netflix and Disney’s Hotstar.
articles.lead_paragraph: “Coolie No. 1” has all the hallmarks of a big Bollywood film: colorful costumes, larger-than-life sets, foot-tapping music and a melodramatic story about a man who pretends he has a twin to woo the woman of his dreams.
articles.byline: By Priya Arora and Karan Deep Singh

articles.headline: Why China Turned Against Jack Ma
articles.snippet: The Alibaba chief paid for pushing back against Beijing. But the shift in attitude also speaks to a growing wealth gap and diminished opportunities for the young.
articles.abstract: The Alibaba chief paid for pushing back against Beijing. But the shift in attitude also speaks to a growing wealth gap and diminished opportunities for the young.
articles.lead_paragraph: In China, Jack Ma is synonymous with success. The English teacher turned internet entrepreneur is the country’s richest person. He founded Alibaba, the closest thing Amazon has to a peer and rival. After Donald J. Trump was elected president in 2016, Mr. Ma was the first high-profile Chinese person he met with.

articles.headline: Britain and E.U. Reach Landmark Deal on Brexit
articles.snippet: The trade agreement comes after months of negotiations, and still leaves critical details to be worked out.
articles.abstract: The trade agreement comes after months of negotiations, and still leaves critical details to be worked out.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Britain and the European Union struck a hard-fought trade agreement on Thursday, settling a bitter divorce that stretched over more than four years and setting the terms for a post-Brexit future as close neighbors living apart.
articles.byline: By Mark Landler and Stephen Castle

articles.headline: Britain Gets a Boost With a Brexit Trade Deal, but Challenges Loom
articles.snippet: The free-trade pact would help both sides avoid tariffs, but Britain would still face economic costs from being outside the European Union.
articles.abstract: The free-trade pact would help both sides avoid tariffs, but Britain would still face economic costs from being outside the European Union.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The British economy got a jolt of confidence Thursday as Britain and the European Union announced an agreement that will define their future trading relationship after years of negotiations since the country voted in 2016 to leave the bloc.
